result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter K Ellsworth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant granted 60 days to pay court costs. If costs not paid, civil judgment to be entered.

-AODA and any counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
-No alcohol.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Defendant to take narcotics prescribed by his doctor and have the container available, if it is needed.
-Not operate motor vehicle without valid driver's license.
-Pay supervision fees.

**Court is not requiring defendant to pay the DNA surcharge.
**If agent feels there are no probationary needs after -3- years, agent may submit early discharge of defendant's probation for Court's review.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Peter K Ellsworth in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties. Court is informed defendant qualifies for the public defender. Defendant does not waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Atty. DeJunco stated he may have to appoint counsel for this case due to a potential conflict. Court orders $5000 w/conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
